list.title: ExcludeSemantics
list.desc: A widget that drops all the semantics of its descendants. This can be used to hide subwidgets that would otherwise be reported but that would only be confusing. For example, the Material Components Chip widget hides the avatar since it is redundant with the chip label.

list.title: MergeSemantics
list.desc: A widget that merges the semantics of its descendants.

list.title: Semantics
list.desc: A widget that annotates the widget tree with a description of the meaning of the widgets. Used by accessibility tools, search engines, and other semantic analysis software to determine the meaning of the application.

list.title: AnimatedAlign
list.desc: Animated version of Align which automatically transitions the child's position over a given duration whenever the given alignment changes.

list.title: AnimatedBuilder
list.desc: A general-purpose widget for building animations. AnimatedBuilder is useful for more complex widgets that wish to include animation as part of a larger build function. To use AnimatedBuilder, simply construct the widget and pass it a builder function.

list.title: AnimatedContainer
list.desc: A container that gradually changes its values over a period of time.

list.title: AnimatedCrossFade
list.desc: A widget that cross-fades between two given children and animates itself between their sizes.

list.title: AnimatedDefaultTextStyle
list.desc: Animated version of DefaultTextStyle which automatically transitions the default text style (the text style to apply to descendant Text widgets without explicit style) over a given duration whenever the given style changes.

list.title: AnimatedListState
list.desc: The state for a scrolling container that animates items when they are inserted or removed.

list.title: AnimatedModalBarrier
list.desc: A widget that prevents the user from interacting with widgets behind itself.

list.title: AnimatedOpacity
list.desc: Animated version of Opacity which automatically transitions the child's opacity over a given duration whenever the given opacity changes.

list.title: AnimatedPhysicalModel
list.desc: Animated version of PhysicalModel.

list.title: AnimatedPositioned
list.desc: Animated version of Positioned which automatically transitions the child's position over a given duration whenever the given position changes.

list.title: AnimatedSize
list.desc: Animated widget that automatically transitions its size over a given duration whenever the given child's size changes.

list.title: AnimatedWidget
list.desc: A widget that rebuilds when the given Listenable changes value.

list.title: AnimatedWidgetBaseState
list.desc: A base class for widgets with implicit animations.

list.title: DecoratedBoxTransition
list.desc: Animated version of a DecoratedBox that animates the different properties of its Decoration.

list.title: FadeTransition
list.desc: Animates the opacity of a widget.

list.title: Hero
list.desc: A widget that marks its child as being a candidate for hero animations.

list.title: PositionedTransition
list.desc: Animated version of Positioned which takes a specific Animation to transition the child's position from a start position to and end position over the lifetime of the animation.

list.title: RotationTransition
list.desc: Animates the rotation of a widget.

list.title: ScaleTransition
list.desc: Animates the scale of transformed widget.

list.title: SizeTransition
list.desc: Animates its own size and clips and aligns the child.

list.title: SlideTransition
list.desc: Animates the position of a widget relative to its normal position.

catalog.title: Assets, Images, and Icons
catalog.desc: Manage assets, display images, and show icons.

list.title: AssetBundle
list.desc: Asset bundles contain resources, such as images and strings, that can be used by an application. Access to these resources is asynchronous so that they can be transparently loaded over a network (e.g., from a NetworkAssetBundle) or from the local file system without blocking the application's user interface.

list.title: Icon
list.desc: A Material Design icon.

list.title: Image
list.desc: A widget that displays an image.

list.title: RawImage
list.desc: A widget that displays a dart:ui.Image directly.

catalog.title: Async
catalog.desc: Async patterns to your Flutter application.

list.title: FutureBuilder
list.desc: Widget that builds itself based on the latest snapshot of interaction with a Future.

list.title: StreamBuilder
list.desc: Widget that builds itself based on the latest snapshot of interaction with a Stream.

catalog.title: Basics
catalog.desc: Widgets you absolutely need to know before building your first Flutter app.

list.title: Appbar
list.desc: A Material Design app bar. An app bar consists of a toolbar and potentially other widgets, such as a TabBar and a FlexibleSpaceBar.

list.title: Column
list.desc: Layout a list of child widgets in the vertical direction.

list.title: Container
list.desc: A convenience widget that combines common painting, positioning, and sizing widgets.

list.title: ElevatedButton
list.desc: A Material Design elevated button. A filled button whose material elevates when pressed.

list.title: FlutterLogo
list.desc: The Flutter logo, in widget form. This widget respects the IconTheme.

list.title: Icon
list.desc: A Material Design icon.

list.title: Image
list.desc: A widget that displays an image.

list.title: Placeholder
list.desc: A widget that draws a box that represents where other widgets will one day be added.

list.title: Row
list.desc: Layout a list of child widgets in the horizontal direction.

list.title: Scaffold
list.desc: Implements the basic Material Design visual layout structure. This class provides APIs for showing drawers, snack bars, and bottom sheets.

list.title: Text
list.desc: A run of text with a single style.

catalog.title: Cupertino (iOS-style widgets)
catalog.desc: Beautiful and high-fidelity widgets for current iOS design language.

list.title: CupertinoActionSheet
list.desc: An iOS-style modal bottom action sheet to choose an option among many.

list.title: CupertinoActivityIndicator
list.desc: An iOS-style activity indicator. Displays a circular 'spinner'.

list.title: CupertinoAlertDialog
list.desc: An iOS-style alert dialog.

list.title: CupertinoButton
list.desc: An iOS-style button.

list.title: CupertinoContextMenu
list.desc: An iOS-style full-screen modal route that opens when the child is long-pressed. Used to display relevant actions for your content.

list.title: CupertinoDatePicker
list.desc: An iOS-style date or date and time picker.

list.title: CupertinoDialog
list.desc: An iOS-style dialog.

list.title: CupertinoDialogAction
list.desc: A button typically used in a CupertinoAlertDialog.

list.title: CupertinoFullscreenDialogTransition
list.desc: An iOS-style transition used for summoning fullscreen dialogs.

list.title: CupertinoNavigationBar
list.desc: An iOS-style top navigation bar. Typically used with CupertinoPageScaffold.

list.title: CupertinoPageScaffold
list.desc: Basic iOS style page layout structure. Positions a navigation bar and content on a background.

list.title: CupertinoPageTransition
list.desc: Provides an iOS-style page transition animation.

list.title: CupertinoPicker
list.desc: An iOS-style picker control. Used to select an item in a short list.

list.title: CupertinoPopupSurface
list.desc: Rounded rectangle surface that looks like an iOS popup surface, such as an alert dialog or action sheet.

list.title: CupertinoScrollbar
list.desc: An iOS-style scrollbar that indicates which portion of a scrollable widget is currently visible.

list.title: CupertinoSearchTextField
list.desc: An iOS-style search field.

list.title: CupertinoSegmentedControl
list.desc: An iOS-style segmented control. Used to select mutually exclusive options in a horizontal list.

list.title: CupertinoSlider
list.desc: Used to select from a range of values.

list.title: CupertinoSlidingSegmentedControl
list.desc: An iOS-13-style segmented control. Used to select mutually exclusive options in a horizontal list.

list.title: CupertinoSliverNavigationBar
list.desc: An iOS-styled navigation bar with iOS-11-style large titles using slivers.

list.title: CupertinoSwitch
list.desc: An iOS-style switch. Used to toggle the on/off state of a single setting.

list.title: CupertinoTabBar
list.desc: An iOS-style bottom tab bar. Typically used with CupertinoTabScaffold.

list.title: CupertinoTabScaffold
list.desc: Tabbed iOS app structure. Positions a tab bar on top of tabs of content.

list.title: CupertinoTabView
list.desc: Root content of a tab that supports parallel navigation between tabs. Typically used with CupertinoTabScaffold.

list.title: CupertinoTextField
list.desc: An iOS-style text field.

list.title: CupertinoTimerPicker
list.desc: An iOS-style countdown timer picker.

catalog.title: Input
catalog.desc: Take user input in addition to input widgets in Material Components and Cupertino.

list.title: Autocomplete
list.desc: A widget for helping the user make a selection by entering some text and choosing from among a list of options.

list.title: Form
list.desc: An optional container for grouping together multiple form field widgets (e.g. TextField widgets).

list.title: FormField
list.desc: A single form field. This widget maintains the current state of the form field, so that updates and validation errors are visually reflected in the UI.

list.title: RawKeyboardListener
list.desc: A widget that calls a callback whenever the user presses or releases a key on a keyboard.

catalog.title: Interaction Models
catalog.desc: Respond to touch events and route users to different views.

list.title: AbsorbPointer
list.desc: A widget that absorbs pointers during hit testing. When absorbing is true, this widget prevents its subtree from receiving pointer events by terminating hit testing at itself. It still consumes space during layout and paints its child as usual. It just prevents its children from being the target of located events, because it returns true from RenderBox.hitTest.

list.title: Dismissible
list.desc: A widget that can be dismissed by dragging in the indicated direction. Dragging or flinging this widget in the DismissDirection causes the child to slide out of view. Following the slide animation, if resizeDuration is non-null, the Dismissible widget animates its height (or width, whichever is perpendicular to the dismiss direction) to zero over the resizeDuration.

list.title: DragTarget
list.desc: A widget that receives data when a Draggable widget is dropped. When a draggable is dragged on top of a drag target, the drag target is asked whether it will accept the data the draggable is carrying. If the user does drop the draggable on top of the drag target (and the drag target has indicated that it will accept the draggable's data), then the drag target is asked to accept the draggable's data.

list.title: Draggable
list.desc: A widget that can be dragged from to a DragTarget. When a draggable widget recognizes the start of a drag gesture, it displays a feedback widget that tracks the user's finger across the screen. If the user lifts their finger while on top of a DragTarget, that target is given the opportunity to accept the data carried by the draggable.

list.title: DraggableScrollableSheet
list.desc: A container for a Scrollable that responds to drag gestures by resizing the scrollable until a limit is reached, and then scrolling.

list.title: GestureDetector
list.desc: A widget that detects gestures. Attempts to recognize gestures that correspond to its non-null callbacks. If this widget has a child, it defers to that child for its sizing behavior. If it does not have a child, it grows to fit the parent instead.

list.title: IgnorePointer
list.desc: A widget that is invisible during hit testing. When ignoring is true, this widget (and its subtree) is invisible to hit testing. It still consumes space during layout and paints its child as usual. It just cannot be the target of located events, because it returns false from RenderBox.hitTest.

list.title: InteractiveViewer
list.desc: A widget that enables pan and zoom interactions with its child.

list.title: LongPressDraggable
list.desc: Makes its child draggable starting from long press.

list.title: Scrollable
list.desc: Scrollable implements the interaction model for a scrollable widget, including gesture recognition, but does not have an opinion about how the viewport, which actually displays the children, is constructed.

list.title: Hero
list.desc: A widget that marks its child as being a candidate for hero animations.

list.title: Navigator
list.desc: A widget that manages a set of child widgets with a stack discipline. Many apps have a navigator near the top of their widget hierarchy to display their logical history using an Overlay with the most recently visited pages visually on top of the older pages. Using this pattern lets the navigator visually transition from one page to another by moving the widgets around in the overlay. Similarly, the navigator can be used to show a dialog by positioning the dialog widget above the current page.

catalog.title: Layout
catalog.desc: Arrange other widgets columns, rows, grids, and many other layouts.

list.title: Align
list.desc: A widget that aligns its child within itself and optionally sizes itself based on the child's size.

list.title: AspectRatio
list.desc: A widget that attempts to size the child to a specific aspect ratio.

list.title: Baseline
list.desc: A widget that positions its child according to the child's baseline.

list.title: Center
list.desc: A widget that centers its child within itself.

list.title: ConstrainedBox
list.desc: A widget that imposes additional constraints on its child.

list.title: Container
list.desc: A convenience widget that combines common painting, positioning, and sizing widgets.

list.title: CustomSingleChildLayout
list.desc: A widget that defers the layout of its single child to a delegate.

list.title: Expanded
list.desc: A widget that expands a child of a Row, Column, or Flex.

list.title: FittedBox
list.desc: Scales and positions its child within itself according to fit.

list.title: FractionallySizedBox
list.desc: A widget that sizes its child to a fraction of the total available space. For more details about the layout algorithm, see RenderFractionallySizedOverflowBox.

list.title: IntrinsicHeight
list.desc: A widget that sizes its child to the child's intrinsic height.

list.title: IntrinsicWidth
list.desc: A widget that sizes its child to the child's intrinsic width.

list.title: LimitedBox
list.desc: A box that limits its size only when it's unconstrained.

list.title: Offstage
list.desc: A widget that lays the child out as if it was in the tree, but without painting anything, without making the child available for hit testing, and without taking any room in the parent.

list.title: OverflowBox
list.desc: A widget that imposes different constraints on its child than it gets from its parent, possibly allowing the child to overflow the parent.

list.title: Padding
list.desc: A widget that insets its child by the given padding.

list.title: SizedBox
list.desc: A box with a specified size. If given a child, this widget forces its child to have a specific width and/or height (assuming values are permitted by this widget's parent). If either the width or height is null, this widget will size itself to match the child's size in that dimension.

list.title: SizedOverflowBox
list.desc: A widget that is a specific size but passes its original constraints through to its child, which will probably overflow.

list.title: Transform
list.desc: A widget that applies a transformation before painting its child.

list.title: Column
list.desc: Layout a list of child widgets in the vertical direction.

list.title: CustomMultiChildLayout
list.desc: A widget that uses a delegate to size and position multiple children.

list.title: Flow
list.desc: A widget that implements the flow layout algorithm.

list.title: GridView
list.desc: A grid list consists of a repeated pattern of cells arrayed in a vertical and horizontal layout. The GridView widget implements this component.

list.title: IndexedStack
list.desc: A Stack that shows a single child from a list of children.

list.title: LayoutBuilder
list.desc: Builds a widget tree that can depend on the parent widget's size.

list.title: ListBody
list.desc: A widget that arranges its children sequentially along a given axis, forcing them to the dimension of the parent in the other axis.

list.title: ListView
list.desc: A scrollable, linear list of widgets. ListView is the most commonly used scrolling widget. It displays its children one after another in the scroll direction. In the cross axis, the children are required to fill the ListView.

list.title: Row
list.desc: Layout a list of child widgets in the horizontal direction.

list.title: Stack
list.desc: This class is useful if you want to overlap several children in a simple way, for example having some text and an image, overlaid with a gradient and a button attached to the bottom.

list.title: Table
list.desc: A widget that uses the table layout algorithm for its children.

list.title: Wrap
list.desc: A widget that displays its children in multiple horizontal or vertical runs.

list.title: CupertinoSliverNavigationBar
list.desc: An iOS-styled navigation bar with iOS-11-style large titles using slivers.

list.title: CustomScrollView
list.desc: A ScrollView that creates custom scroll effects using slivers.

list.title: SliverAppBar
list.desc: A material design app bar that integrates with a CustomScrollView.

list.title: SliverChildBuilderDelegate
list.desc: A delegate that supplies children for slivers using a builder callback.

list.title: SliverChildListDelegate
list.desc: A delegate that supplies children for slivers using an explicit list.

list.title: SliverFixedExtentList
list.desc: A sliver that places multiple box children with the same main axis extent in a linear array.

list.title: SliverGrid
list.desc: A sliver that places multiple box children in a two dimensional arrangement.

list.title: SliverList
list.desc: A sliver that places multiple box children in a linear array along the main axis.

list.title: SliverPadding
list.desc: A sliver that applies padding on each side of another sliver.

list.title: SliverPersistentHeader
list.desc: A sliver whose size varies when the sliver is scrolled to the edge of the viewport opposite the sliver's GrowthDirection.

list.title: SliverToBoxAdapter
list.desc: A sliver that contains a single box widget.

catalog.title: Material Components
catalog.desc: Visual, behavioral, and motion-rich widgets implementing the Material Design guidelines.

list.title: Appbar
list.desc: A Material Design app bar. An app bar consists of a toolbar and potentially other widgets, such as a TabBar and a FlexibleSpaceBar.

list.title: BottomNavigationBar
list.desc: Bottom navigation bars make it easy to explore and switch between top-level views in a single tap. The BottomNavigationBar widget implements this component.

list.title: Drawer
list.desc: A Material Design panel that slides in horizontally from the edge of a Scaffold to show navigation links in an application.

list.title: MaterialApp
list.desc: A convenience widget that wraps a number of widgets that are commonly required for applications implementing Material Design.

list.title: Scaffold
list.desc: Implements the basic Material Design visual layout structure. This class provides APIs for showing drawers, snack bars, and bottom sheets.

list.title: SliverAppBar
list.desc: A material design app bar that integrates with a CustomScrollView.

list.title: TabBar
list.desc: A Material Design widget that displays a horizontal row of tabs.

list.title: TabBarView
list.desc: A page view that displays the widget which corresponds to the currently selected tab. Typically used in conjunction with a TabBar.

list.title: TabController
list.desc: Coordinates tab selection between a TabBar and a TabBarView.

list.title: TabPageSelector
list.desc: Displays a row of small circular indicators, one per tab. The selected tab's indicator is highlighted. Often used in conjunction with a TabBarView.

list.title: WidgetsApp
list.desc: A convenience class that wraps a number of widgets that are commonly required for an application.

list.title: DropdownButton
list.desc: Shows the currently selected item and an arrow that opens a menu for selecting another item.

list.title: ElevatedButton
list.desc: A Material Design elevated button. A filled button whose material elevates when pressed.

list.title: FloatingActionButton
list.desc: A floating action button is a circular icon button that hovers over content to promote a primary action in the application. Floating action buttons are most commonly used in the Scaffold.floatingActionButton field.

list.title: IconButton
list.desc: An icon button is a picture printed on a Material widget that reacts to touches by filling with color (ink).

list.title: OutlinedButton
list.desc: A Material Design outlined button, essentially a TextButton with an outlined border.

list.title: PopupMenuButton
list.desc: Displays a menu when pressed and calls onSelected when the menu is dismissed because an item was selected.

list.title: TextButton
list.desc: A Material Design text button. A simple flat button without a border outline.

list.title: Checkbox
list.desc: Checkboxes allow the user to select multiple options from a set. The Checkbox widget implements this component.

list.title: Date & Time Pickers
list.desc: Date pickers use a dialog window to select a single date on mobile. Time pickers use a dialog to select a single time (in the hours:minutes format) on mobile.

list.title: Radio
list.desc: Radio buttons allow the user to select one option from a set. Use radio buttons for exclusive selection if you think that the user needs to see all available options side-by-side.

list.title: Slider
list.desc: Sliders let users select from a range of values by moving the slider thumb.

list.title: Switch
list.desc: On/off switches toggle the state of a single settings option. The Switch widget implements this component.

list.title: TextField
list.desc: Touching a text field places the cursor and displays the keyboard. The TextField widget implements this component.

list.title: AlertDialog
list.desc: Alerts are urgent interruptions requiring acknowledgement that inform the user about a situation. The AlertDialog widget implements this component.

list.title: BottomSheet
list.desc: Bottom sheets slide up from the bottom of the screen to reveal more content. You can call showBottomSheet() to implement a persistent bottom sheet or showModalBottomSheet() to implement a modal bottom sheet.

list.title: ExpansionPanel
list.desc: Expansion panels contain creation flows and allow lightweight editing of an element. The ExpansionPanel widget implements this component.

list.title: SimpleDialog
list.desc: Simple dialogs can provide additional details or actions about a list item. For example they can display avatars icons clarifying subtext or orthogonal actions (such as adding an account).

list.title: SnackBar
list.desc: A lightweight message with an optional action which briefly displays at the bottom of the screen.

list.title: Card
list.desc: A Material Design card. A card has slightly rounded corners and a shadow.

list.title: Chip
list.desc: A Material Design chip. Chips represent complex entities in small blocks, such as a contact.

list.title: CircularProgressIndicator
list.desc: A material design circular progress indicator, which spins to indicate that the application is busy.

list.title: DataTable
list.desc: Data tables display sets of raw data. They usually appear in desktop enterprise products. The DataTable widget implements this component.

list.title: GridView
list.desc: A grid list consists of a repeated pattern of cells arrayed in a vertical and horizontal layout. The GridView widget implements this component.

list.title: Icon
list.desc: A Material Design icon.

list.title: Image
list.desc: A widget that displays an image.

list.title: LinearProgressIndicator
list.desc: A material design linear progress indicator, also known as a progress bar.

list.title: Tooltip
list.desc: Tooltips provide text labels that help explain the function of a button or other user interface action. Wrap the button in a Tooltip widget to show a label when the widget long pressed (or when the user takes some other appropriate action).

list.title: Divider
list.desc: A one logical pixel thick horizontal line, with padding on either side.

list.title: ListTile
list.desc: A single fixed-height row that typically contains some text as well as a leading or trailing icon.

list.title: Stepper
list.desc: A Material Design stepper widget that displays progress through a sequence of steps.

catalog.title: Painting and effects
catalog.desc: These widgets apply visual effects to the children without changing their layout, size, or position.

list.title: BackdropFilter
list.desc: A widget that applies a filter to the existing painted content and then paints a child. This effect is relatively expensive, especially if the filter is non-local, such as a blur.

list.title: ClipOval
list.desc: A widget that clips its child using an oval.

list.title: ClipPath
list.desc: A widget that clips its child using a path.

list.title: ClipRect
list.desc: A widget that clips its child using a rectangle.

list.title: CustomPaint
list.desc: A widget that provides a canvas on which to draw during the paint phase.

list.title: DecoratedBox
list.desc: A widget that paints a Decoration either before or after its child paints.

list.title: FractionalTranslation
list.desc: A widget that applies a translation expressed as a fraction of the box's size before painting its child.

list.title: Opacity
list.desc: A widget that makes its child partially transparent.

list.title: RotatedBox
list.desc: A widget that rotates its child by a integral number of quarter turns.

list.title: Transform
list.desc: A widget that applies a transformation before painting its child.

catalog.title: Scrolling
catalog.desc: Scroll multiple widgets as children of the parent.

list.title: CustomScrollView
list.desc: A ScrollView that creates custom scroll effects using slivers.

list.title: DraggableScrollableSheet
list.desc: A container for a Scrollable that responds to drag gestures by resizing the scrollable until a limit is reached, and then scrolling.

list.title: GridView
list.desc: A grid list consists of a repeated pattern of cells arrayed in a vertical and horizontal layout. The GridView widget implements this component.

list.title: ListView
list.desc: A scrollable, linear list of widgets. ListView is the most commonly used scrolling widget. It displays its children one after another in the scroll direction. In the cross axis, the children are required to fill the ListView.

list.title: NestedScrollView
list.desc: A scrolling view inside of which can be nested other scrolling views, with their scroll positions being intrinsically linked.

list.title: NotificationListener
list.desc: A widget that listens for Notifications bubbling up the tree.

list.title: PageView
list.desc: A scrollable list that works page by page.

list.title: RefreshIndicator
list.desc: A Material Design pull-to-refresh wrapper for scrollables.

list.title: ReorderableListView
list.desc: A list whose items the user can interactively reorder by dragging.

list.title: ScrollConfiguration
list.desc: Controls how Scrollable widgets behave in a subtree.

list.title: Scrollable
list.desc: Scrollable implements the interaction model for a scrollable widget, including gesture recognition, but does not have an opinion about how the viewport, which actually displays the children, is constructed.

list.title: Scrollbar
list.desc: A Material Design scrollbar. A scrollbar indicates which portion of a Scrollable widget is actually visible.

list.title: SingleChildScrollView
list.desc: A box in which a single widget can be scrolled. This widget is useful when you have a single box that will normally be entirely visible, for example a clock face in a time picker, but you need to make sure it can be scrolled if the container gets too small in one axis (the scroll direction).

catalog.title: Styling
catalog.desc: Manage the theme of your app, makes your app responsive to screen sizes, or add padding.

list.title: MediaQuery
list.desc: Establishes a subtree in which media queries resolve to the given data.

list.title: Padding
list.desc: A widget that insets its child by the given padding.

list.title: Theme
list.desc: Applies a theme to descendant widgets. A theme describes the colors and typographic choices of an application.

list.title: DefaultTextStyle
list.desc: The text style to apply to descendant Text widgets without explicit style.

list.title: RichText
list.desc: The RichText widget displays text that uses multiple different styles. The text to display is described using a tree of TextSpan objects, each of which has an associated style that is used for that subtree. The text might break across multiple lines or might all be displayed on the same line depending on the layout constraints.

list.title: Text
list.desc: A run of text with a single style.
